title: Conveyance 2015 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The winery indicates this is a reserve, but that term is well hidden (if there at all) on the label. Firmly tannic, with tightly wound cherry and cola flavors, this finishes with some dark, charred notes.

title: Cortes de Cima 2017 Dois Terroirs Branco White (Alentejano)
description: One of a pair of similarly named red wines, this fruity blend, from two different vineyards areas, includes Viognier and Verdelho, Softly fruity, with a touch of earthy spice from the barrel aging, the wine is open and generous. Drink now.

title: Crossbarn by Paul Hobbs 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Rich and round, the tannins in this full-bodied wine are sweet and elongated, with a midpalate of cassis, crayon wax and mocha swirling around one another and smoky, toasted oak.

title: Cusumano 2017 Angimbè Tenuta Ficuzza White (Terre Siciliane)
description: A blend of 70% Insolia and 30% Chardonnay, this has aromas of ripe pear, acacia and a whiff of bread crust. The linear palate evokes yellow apple, citrus and bitter almond alongside fresh acidity. A salty note marks the close.

title: Delamotte NV Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine is full, with a rich mousse and a soft character. The red-currant flavor is cut by a mineral texture as well as light acidity. Nothing is in excess, and this wine is bright and ready to drink.

title: Domaine Anthony Girard 2017 La Clef du Récit Rosé (Sancerre)
description: This rich rosé is full of red fruits balanced by good acidity. Red-berry flavors dominate, giving the wine ripeness as well as structure. Drink now.

title: Domaine Armand Gaston 2017  Menetou-Salon
description: With a light touch, bright acidity and layers of mineral acidity, this wine is packed with fruitiness that contrasts with the tight texture. Drink this pure, crisp wine now.

title: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2017 Origine Rosé (Sancerre)
description: This attractive red-fruit-flavored wine has a soft texture. The acidity and warm strawberry flavor are nicely balanced, crisp and ready to drink now.

title: Educated Guess 2016 Red (North Coast)
description: This full-bodied wine offers a ripe fruit aroma that is generously shaded by tones of vanilla, nutmeg, cedar and smoke. It has a touch of tannins that strengthen the texture.

title: Flower Garden 2017 Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Pink grapefruit flavors are mouthwatering and juicy in this fruity, uncomplicated Riesling. Hints of salt and grapefruit pith on the midpalate lend a Paloma-like refreshment. A light-bodied, approachable sip to enjoy now–2020.

title: Fowles Wine 2016 Ladies Who Shoot Their Lunch Wild Ferment Pinot Noir (Victoria)
description: An easygoing, plush style of Pinot, this wine displays notes of ripe red berries and oak spices. There's a rush of tart acidity on the palate, along with spicy, grainy tannins.
designation: Ladies Who Shoot Their Lunch Wild Ferment

title: Golser Wein NV Una Bubbly Rosé Sparkling (Burgenland)
description: A lively pink froth immediately signals ease and enjoyment. Floral overtones on the nose along with confected berry fruit continue with the same fruity ease on the off-dry palate, where strawberry notes take over. An easy, fun, pink party fizz. Drink soon.

title: Graham Beck 2013 Premium Cuvée Méthode Cap Classique Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (Robertson)
description: This is delicate and reserved in aromatic profile, with hints of apple, melon rind and fresh straw that lightly dance in the bouquet. It's a bit more boastful in character on the palate, with a round texture that's balanced by medium carbonation and a brisk minerality that shines through and picks up the finish.
designation: Premium Cuvée Méthode Cap Classique Blanc de Blancs Brut

title: Guerra 2017 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Raspberry, plum and black currant aromas are bright and fruity. This everyday Bierzo feels fresh and lively, with flavors of cassis and raspberry buoyed by rubbery tannins.

title: Hermann J. Wiemer 2016 Semi-Dry Estate Bottled & Grown Riesling (Seneca Lake)
description: Aromas of lemon rind, green pear and ginger spice offer a moderately concentrated nose. The palate shows a light impression of juicy apple and lemon-lime, ending brisk and clean.

title: Jean Laurent NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This ripe wine is ripe has a soft character from its relatively high dosage. That makes for a wine that is rich and fruity, with a gentle aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Ken Forrester 2014 Sparklehorse Méthode Cap Classique Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)
description: This wine has a pronounced yeasty, autolytic character that rides atop scents of dried apple skin, grilled challah, pie crust and orange peel. A lively mousse and mouthwatering acidity helps to keep the palate in check, lifting the rich and toasty flavors through the finish. Drink now.

title: Kramer 2015 Cardiac Hill Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: All of Kramer's new Pinots are surprisingly low in alcohol, but then again, much of the winery's fruit goes into sparkling wines, which are always picked earlier. This Pommard/Dijon 115 blend shows light blue fruits and some of the same chicken yard funkiness as the Rebecca's Reserve.

title: Kramer 2015 Rebecca's Reserve Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: A curious wine, which starts out aromatically intriguing with roses and raspberries. In the mouth some funky chicken yard flavors come in, closing down the finish. Hard to tell if further bottle aging will curtail or enhance that funky finish.

title: Lamadrid 2016 Single Vineyard Reserva Malbec (Agrelo)
description: Ripe, raisiny aromas include barrel-based notes of vanilla, cocoa and graphite. Hailing from a cool, rainy year like 2016, this is surprisingly full, extracted and traditional is style. Raisin and cassis notes carry the flavor profile to a slightly syrupy finish.
